review text: This might be a fake aquaphor so people beware. I have always purchased at either target or Wal-Mart and will go back to doing that. I use it on both my toddler for diaper rashes on a daily use. Well this tub has a yellowish tint to it, I compared it to the store bought aquaphor tubes (travel ones) and the tubes ointment was a clear color and a thicker paste, and the tub has a yellow tint and is not really thick, I only became aware of the difference because my son‚Äôs rash is getting worse rather than better and now he is getting his rash outside the diaper. I am guessing it‚Äôs an allergic reaction to this tub aquaphor. So parents please use with caution.

review name: Amazon, check your sourcing for this product
review text:
Edit: we have continued to use Aquaphor from Amazon, and aside from the one weird jar that we got a while ago, it‚Äôs been great. Prevents bum rash like a dream when applied liberally with every diaper change üëç

Amazon needs to double check their sourcing. The first time I ordered this, it was awesome. It‚Äôs so great for preventative skin care. I use it at almost every diaper change and my baby has literally NEVER had a diaper rash. However, second time I ordered this product from Amazon, I got a tub of what looked a lot more like Vasaline than Aquaphor. I know the two products are pretty similar, but I‚Äôm disappointed :( Maybe Aquaphor had a bad batch or changed it‚Äôs processing or something, but Amazon‚Äôs sourcing is the more likely culprit.

review name: I received a very strange container. It had no ...
review text: I received a very strange container. It had no labeling. It was white with a blue lid. Not sure if authentic or not. Returning to Amazon. See pics.

Like others said, this aquaphor bought on amazon is different than the ones I have bought at local grocery stores or Walmart, it has a yellow tint to it and is a lot softer than the others. It does seem to work fine tho, I have twins & I go through a lot of this stuff! however seems weird to me & I won‚Äôt be buying anymore on amazon. Pictured is the one from amazon compared to one I bought locally.

review name: Adult Use for Hydrating, Healing, Chub rub magician.
review text:
So close to 5 stars. This product is AMAZING! The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because I don't love the slightly greasy texture and finish (it is not a lotion. Almost same texture as Vaseline). However, it is hands down the most hydrating and healing product I have ever used for my skin surpassing dermatologist prescribed healing ointments and steroids. My skin was WRECKED! For over 2 years I taught swim lessons for 20 hours a week in combination salt water/chlorine pool. I finally had to quit when a new prescription caused me to experience contact dermatitis every time I went in the water. The damage was extensive. Within days of using this product my dried, scaly, cracked and bleeding skin was healing. My arm hair started growing back within a week. My cuticles stopped peeling back from the nails. And the most unanticipated additional use is phenomenal as a chub-rub protector and healer.
Since the weather is getting nicer, I've been hiking anywhere from 2-5 miles a day. Unfortunately on this past Monday eve, I wore the wrong leggings and experienced a terrible case of chub rub. It finally occurred to me last night after 3 days of suffering that I could use this close to my privates because it's usually used for diaper rash and on babies sensitive skin. This morning when I woke up pain-free and to much smoother skin. Also, a little goes a long way. I'll update in the future when I run out but I imagine that's going to be some point next year.

This is the best possible stuff to use on gentle baby skin. My little one screamed every time I tried every other lotion- this fixes EVERYTHING!!! She started to get some dry spots and mild eczema and after putting this on every night, it was better in a matter of days and completely gone in a few weeks!!! It's now the go-to product in our house!

review name: Best diaper ointment I have found!!
review text:
So after trying Desitin (noooo, smells like fish), A&D ointment (never again) and burts bees diaper cream (eeeh ok) , this stuff produced miracles!! My baby doesn't get bad diaper rash, but it was hard to find a cream that wouldn't make slight redness worse!
Then I found this ointment!! It has a Vaseline vibe, goes on easy, wipes off easy, has great protection for my babe's skin, and no adverse reactions!! Love this stuff!! Also great for drool rash for a teething baby. It has cleared up my little ones skin in less than a day!! Highly recommend!!

THIS PRODUCT IS NOT WHAT IS EXPECTED! IT IS FALSE ADVERTISING I EVEN TOOK THIS PRODUCT TO MY DAUGHTER PEDIATRICIAN AND SHE ALSO SAID IT WAS NOTHING BUT VASELINE IN A JAR!!! MY DAUGHTER HAD SUCH A BAD RADH IT TURNED INTO A SERIOUS INFECTION....I HAVE CONTACTED AMAZON AND REQUESTED THIS ITEM TO BE REMOVED FROM THEIR SITE. IT IS APPALLING FOR THIS VENDOR TO BE SELLING THIS AND THE STRESS IT CAUSED ME WAS SO HEARTBREAKING. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT PLEASE SAVE YOYR MONEY TIME AND CHILD!

Living in the desert in the winter means see really dry chapped skin for me and the kids. I've had this one jar for about 6 months and we use it daily. My kids both have severe eczema. I put this on their breakouts and within a couple days , it's cured. My oldest gets very dry cracked hands from all the hand washing at school. I started keeping a little bit in a container for him to put on at school and his hands are back to normal and no longer hurting. I will put this on my feet with socks on at bed and my feet are instantly more moisturized in one night. This ointment works miracles.

I love this stuff! It's my last step (occlusive step) after my nighttime skincare routine. It locks in moisture, soothes, protects. It heals chapped lips overnight. Dryness doesn't stand a chance! It heals blemishes SUPER fast, once they are flat I will apply a big blob to it overnight, and it keeps the wound soft, scab free, and redness is reduced by a lot by the next AM. This jar also lasts a REALLY long time. I actually only bought a new one because I had dropped mine a while ago and it cracked on the bottom. I taped it up with some clear tape, but once I get close to the bottom I will open my fresh jar, so I don't risk putting contaminated ointment on my face :P
/skincareaddiction
/asianbeauty

My baby had a severe diaper rash after released from the NICU. The nirses tried everything. Every ointment available, changed my baby‚Äôs diapey, some films that stuck on his little bottom to act as a barrier. Nothing worked.
We cured my baby‚Äôs severe rash by washing his bottom every time we changed his diaper. Every hour or so. We put corn starch every time (Maizena found in the mexican products) This dried his fissures. Then, I tried Aquaphor. Within 6 hours, my baby‚Äôs bottom was significantly better and within 3 days, he healed. It was a miracle. I know it was the Aquaphor because he had this rash for 4 weeks! We now rinse his bottom every time and if he poops, I wash it with baby wash. My bany is now 3 months old and never has had another rash! It was hard work, but saved on wipes too.

I am a new mom with a 2 month old baby boy. We received multiple different kinds of diaper creams from our baby shower and so have tried a few including two kinds of Burt's Bees and Butt Paste. So far Aquaphor is my favorite. We first tried it when we noticed baby was starting to get a rash between his cheeks. The rash stayed very small and was totally gone within two days. Since then we have been using Aquaphor every night before bedtime and after baths. Baby has not had any other diaper rashes. Keeps his buns looking nice and smooth with no irritation. It is colorless, odorless, and goes on easily. Wipes off easily as well. An added benefit for me is that I find cleaning up baby after a dirty diaper to be a breeze when he has Aquaphor on his skin. It has also helped soften and moisturize my hands which were becoming quite dry from all the hand washing you do with a new baby.

Don‚Äôt buy! I love aquaphor been using it for 10years but this one from Amazon has some bead like things in it. Similar to clumpy batter. Idk what it is but aquaphor in store doesn‚Äôt have this issue

I had received a big tub of this for a gift for my baby shower. Never heard of this brand before but sooooooo highly recommend it! Absolutely love this for everything...diaper rash, dry skin, scratches, extremely minor burns, irritated and sensitive skin and soooo much many more uses. Lol Two years later after baby being born still my go to cream.
I‚Äôm definitely a fan now!

I use this after every diaper change on baby's bum and folds, not just when there's a rash. I think because I've used it every day, we haven't encountered a rash yet. It's not as sticky as I was expecting it to be so that's always a plus. I sanitize my hands afterward so whatever stickiness there is on my hands, goes away. I also apply a layer just below baby's waist - from the tummy to where the diaper tabs are.

I've attached a picture so you can see the texture of the product. It's also great to use on baby's cuts/bruises (thanks to their mad-sharp fingernails).

I haven't had the need to use any other product so yay!

I use this for everything. My LO has dry skin in certain places and regular lotion wasn't helping. Since it is greasy I just use a very very small amount and rub it on problem areas. Since he has hardly any hair I tried this on his scalp to see if it would help with cradle cap, and it has done wonders. I put just a very little amount (less than a pea size for his whole head) on his cradle cap and then brush it with a brush and it is keeping it under control very nicely. I also use it often on his forehead, which was a little dry and would get irritated when he rubs it on us when he is tired - now his forehead looks great (although I keep using it because if I stop it gets dry again). This tub will probably last me a few years because a little goes a long way.

I love Aquaphor baby ointment, it relieves my daughter‚Äôs diaper rash.But this one it‚Äôs different from the one I bought at the store. The color is more yellow and it does not works with diaper rash. I really trust items sold by amazon,but it made me disappointed this time. Please do not buy it!!!

My newborn had awful diarrhea, it was so bad we went through a months worth of diapers in ten days. Her diaper rash became so severe we could no longer use wipes and had resorted to gently rinsing her bottom off after each diaper change. She would scream in agony throughout the entire diaper changing process it was heartbreaking. We tried several popular pastes/creams but nothing was making a difference, in fact it was getting worse.

Our pediatrician highly recommended Aquaphor ointment & she sent us home with some samples. We noticed a difference within a day or two so I bought this for home & a tube to keep in the diaper bag. Within a week her bottom was nearly fully healed. And now at 3 weeks old she is free of diaper rash. It's amazing how quickly & effectively this stuff works, I was honestly shocked. I will never use anything but this ointment for diaper rash.

I generally have no issues with aquaphor (and we go through a lot of it!) but this last shipment of it was clumpy (almost like beady if that makes sense). Disappointed as we missed the window to return and now have a lot of it and its hard to spread on our little ones ‚òπÔ∏è

It‚Äôs sealed inside so I know it‚Äôs new. My baby has eczema at 2 months and I was frantic to find a cure. I want to see his baby soft clear skin again! His doctor suggested Aquaphor but she didn‚Äôt tell me any specific instructions. So I gently cleaned his face with water using his soft towel and applied it. In a few minutes his rashes flared red - I got scared that I made a big mistake! I quickly wiped it off with water again. The next day his skin looks more moisturized and less red and flaky. So I did that routine: cleanse-moisturize-cleanse it off. It really works! He looks cuter than ever!!

This product was a life saver. I took accutane for 6 months and had extremely dry skin and lips the entire time. For those of you that don‚Äôt know accutane is a medication for acne and it drys up all your oil glands so your left with no oil in your body. This causes the lips to peel and be constantly dry, raw and painful. A YouTubed recommended this for lips. I used it every single day, several times a day thru my accutane journey and it is the best thing to moisturize your lips. For some reason the baby one is better at keeping. Your lips and body moisturized for longer. I carried this tub in my purse every day and swear by it. If your taking accutane I 100% recommend getting this.
Anyone else that suffers from dry lips should try this because if it works when taking drying medication I‚Äôm sure it will help you.
Product/ingredient is awesome. But, such an expensive product, and the container arrived cracked! Ointment spilled all over. Not happy!

I have used this fir the last 20 years on all my children's diaper area every time they are changed. All my kids have eczema and VERY sensitive skin. They would get a terrible rash from urine and even worse from pooping after just minutes. I would literally need to run as soon as they went. After finding this, I just started rubbing it all over the diaper area with each diaper change. No more rashes whatsoever unless they got diarrhea, which I then used regular desitin (not the creamy-that made it worse). This is also great where their rashes are: behind the knees, on elbows and arms, wherever their eczema was.

review name: Brown coloration and thin course texture
review text:
All 3 containers that I purchased had a strange consistency. I at first did not mind however after it started giving my baby a rash I stopped using the product. I have 2 other containers that I purchased from another supplier (BuyBuy Baby) which were of normal thick consistency and texture that i had previously and they did not give my child a rash.
I have attached a picture of one of the containers. I opened the other just to see if it was just one that was defective but all of them were.
I dont know if I can return this product or if i can just get my money back for a defective product. please advise.
Thank you.

I really like this as a diaper cream. This does not smell or leave white streaks like colored diaper rash creams. I feel like this is pretty easy on sensitive skin. While I would probably use something with a higher percentage of zinc oxide if my baby actually got bad diaper rash, I typically put this on my baby every night as a preventive measure juuuuust in case.

I like the tubs because it's easier to get the cream out. The squeeze bottles get slippery if the cream ends up on the bottle and the cream is super thick and hard to squeeze out so your baby will probably get bored while waiting, see something shiny, and crawl away before you've gotten any out.

If you don't have a diaper cream applicator like the bum brush or nuby copycat- get one. It is so wonderful to avoid getting waterproof cream under your fingernails.

I'm a huge believer in the magic of aquaphor. I've been using this on my baby since he was newborn, and still using this on him at 18 months. My baby has never had a diaper rash. I full attribute that to frequently, daily application of baby aquaphor to his behind every diaper change. It's thicker than vaseline but applies just as smoothly. One jar lasts forever, i think I've bought 3 jars in my kids 18 months of life. It also worked wonders on his dry, chapped skin from drool rash on his face, to dry skin caused by frigid winter air. One application and I can feel the difference in his skin; it immediately cleared up any dry patches and prevented worsening drool rash. It has 0 scent to it; my son is sensitive to scented lotions and creams but has had no issues with aquaphor. I always recommend baby aquaphor to all my new mom friends as my first choice for a diaper/barrier cream!

I love this ointment. In every way, it is better than the leading product(s) we grew up using. It has no fragrance, safe for very sensitive skin, has no taste, very moisturizing, easily washed off, penetrates skin to soften & moisturize w/o leaving a greasy residue. Works great to protect injured skin like lips, sunburns, scrapes, cracked finger tips & cuticles, feet & toes, etc. We use it for everything. This quantity in a jar is a tremendous value over the tiny tube for lips. It is also the best lip moisturizer I've ever used. My dermatologist recommended it too. It is the one product that works for many needs. It was well packaged & arrived on time.

As parents, this is probably something you would like to have especially in the coming winter time when the air gets dry. Our son had skin conditions when he was few months old and we use this constantly to keep his skin moisturized and smooth. It‚Äôs highly recommended if your child has sensitive skin, obviously speak to your child‚Äôs pediatrician regarding this product before you use it.

review name: Works great for dry baby skin (and dry mom skin!)
review text: I bought this Aquaphor ointment when my daughter started getting dry skin patches all over her body (I believe it‚Äôs from the heating in our house, we live in a place that gets very cold during the winter and we have the heat on 24/7 for months at a time, and I think it was starting to make her skin dry). Within 1 day of using this ointment at every diaper change throughout the day, her skin was back to the smooth baby soft feel it should have! I am very pleased with this product and even use it on myself sometimes (I get very dry hands from working with them a lot). It works awesome!

review name: Came with hard lumps in it. I‚Äôm not sure ...
review text: Came with hard lumps in it. I‚Äôm not sure if it sat in the heat too long or what but it wasn‚Äôt the usual aquaphor consistency.

My daughter is 2 months and I‚Äôm assuming she has very sensitive skin because I cannot use just anything on her. I ordered this product for her diaper rash because Desitin was not taking away all of the redness. This product did work, but only for a couple days. The redness completely disappeared, and after about three days the redness came back, but it‚Äôs now worse and her skin feels very rough/chapped. Not sure why. For that reason I‚Äôm giving it 1 star. Wish it continued working for her but unfortunately it didn‚Äôt. Now I have to find another diaper rash cream.

Absolutely love Aquaphor, has come handy on my eczema, but recently I developed dry chapped heels and I used every lotion possible to help and it was making it worse. Then I saw that Aquaphor helps with chapped heels so of course I started using it right away and within a day the pain of dried chapped heels went away and within a week my heels were healed. ü§ó

review name: Does NOT irratate my extremely sensitive skin!
review text: I love this product! I have dealt with psoriasis my whole life! What a relief this is....also, I am a CDL driver always washing my hands and cracking them. Living in Colorado we have very dry air, and for allergy sufferers- every season can be a challenge. I use this every night to gently remove make up, and every mornimg after shower to trap In moisture. I leave it on the damp skin for 15 minutes, I wipe off the excess. I also have noticed tighter skin on my face using this twice a day. I really have no negative as last night as you figure out how it best works for your skin.

We have been using Aquaphor for almost two years. It's undoubtedly the best diaper area care product we've ever used. Our little one was born was dry skin and eczema, which occasionally made her diaper area dry and irritated. After shopping around, our pediatrician recommended this product. We've been using it for nearly two years and haven't looked back since. Every single diaper change is followed by an application of Aquaphor to prevent rashes (it's also great with healing rashes). It has a thick consistency so it helps maintain moisture. We ordered these from Amazon about once every two months or so, and we've never been disappointed.

I have been using this product for about 1 year now. A friend recommended for my son‚Äôs butt rash. I HAVE NEVER USED A BETTER PRODUCT, it is extremly good and really does heal rashes within hours . For severe butt rash usually helps by reducing at least 70% by morning. I have also discovered many other uses for it. Skin burn, other types of rashes, allergies and the best EVER .... for ECZEMA AND PSORIASIS!!!!!
I have eczema and psoriasis and nothing helped as quick as this oitment. IT IS TRUELY A MIRACLE OINTMENT! I have severe eczema on my hands and scalp. You need to apply a very generous amount in order for this ointment to work it‚Äôs best!
I highly recommend this ointment to absoutely every person. It is a must have in a house hold.
Everyone I know has gotten this as a gift from me and loved it!
I had butned me entire hand before and stuck it in the jar and no joke, there is absolutely no scar!!!!

I bought aqauphor just to try it. I‚Äôm a first time mom but the oldest of 4 with large age gaps in between my siblings so i did a LOT of diaper changing with my mom swearing by Boudreaux‚Äôs Butt Paste! Boudreaux‚Äôs worked well but was a paste so it was messy, had a weird smell, got stuck under my nails...so many other cons! Aquaphor has been a game changer for me! It‚Äôs a protective barrier so it prevents diaper rash from happening! I‚Äôve also used it on my dry hands, chapped lips, and the cuts on my daughter‚Äôs ankles from the bands placed on her legs after being born. It‚Äôs very easy to apply and doesn‚Äôt leave a super greasy film. At our first dr appointment the pediatrician asked what i planned on using and when i told him, he said aquaphor was his favorite product and recommends it to everyone!

I love this for everything. Huge size tub. I use it for my sons diaper rash but also if he has any dry spots on his skin anywhere on his body. It's really absorbent and not super greasy. It works into the skin fairly quickly. Great for wintertime when little noses and lips get red from constant wiping. My son is almost 2 and we've been using this since he was born. Excellent for diaper rash and everyday usage. We also use cloth diapers and it's important to have a product that works with cloth. This definitely does so it's a win win all around for us.

I wish I would have found this sooner. My sun had little bumps from something irritating his skin come up on his legs, as well as some dry eczema patches on his body. Literally, within a few hours of applying this to his skin the bumpy patches were gone, and the bumps seemed to go away as well. This product also works great for diaper rashes which is a huge plus. I was expecting to get lotion, but this works just as well and leaves his skin soft. I have raved and raved about this product to everyone! If you have a baby with any kind of rash,dry spots, red bumps, diaper rash, this is literally the BEST product I've ever used and I have 4 kids.

Get a butt-cream applicator, though! Applying it with your hands is not much fun ;)

The moment I saw the telltale spots of a possible diaper rash on my newborn, I put this on her with a fresh diaper; within two hours (ie the next diaper change), the spots were gone! This ointment does well healing the rashes, and my baby does not mind having it applied to her skin.

I soon bought one of those little silicon spatulas (a travel size), and it works great with this jar, keeping my hands clean and vaseline-free while I then close up her diaper and put the lid back on. It has become part of every diaper change!

review name: Anyone that has a baby needs this!
review text: This is a great way to keep diaper rash away and help heal any skin woes too. We used this a big box store brand intermittently since my daughter was 1 week old and she is now 13 months and hasn't had a day of diaper rash since we began using it. We found this product though the recommendation of our pediatrician and am so glad she told us about it as it has saved my baby from ever having diaper rash beyond her first week of life when we found out she was allergic to most butt creams.

It did nothing for my babies drool rash. Almost made it worse. Brand name Vaseline seems to work bets honestly. Weird but ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Also I did notice a yellow tint to mine as well, I‚Äôve never bought this before so it didn‚Äôt throw me off at first but after reading many knockoff reviews. That might be what‚Äôs happening.

Works great for my baby boy. He had a slight red rash above his private area from urine in the diaper. This puts a great protective barrier keeping his sensitive skin rash free!

I've used several products before settling on this 1, Burt's bees is okay but very expensive in comparison. Destin worked briefly but didn't let the area completely clear up from redness. He has very sensitive skin, so thank you aquaphor and Dove soap+lotion for keeping his skin baby soft and rash free.

review name: For eczema and diaper rash - IT WORKS!
review text: I honestly do NOT like the feel of the product, it is so thick it feels like lard. However, even with that being said, it is a must have in our household. My son has pretty bad eczema, we tried a number of different products (Eucerin, burts and bees, etc.) that only this ointment can claim it down. Also, my son had a really bad diaper rash once. We put a thick layer of it on the effected area right before bed, and when he woke up in the morning the rash no longer bothers him. It has no scent what so ever which is also very nice. Overall, to us this produce is a necessary evil, you may not feel good when applying it, but it gets the job done!

My pediatrician has recommended this several times, and I am glad I tried it. I found the claim that it will relieve diaper rash within 6 hours to be true, which is impressive! I don't notice a scent.

Tip: scoop out a bit with your finger tip and put it on the back of your hand before you take off your baby's diaper. That way, you don't have to reach into the tub with potentially-dirty hands.

review name: Love this product. NO diaper rash
review text: I have been using this since my son was born, and he has never had a diaper rash or chafing. I really appreciate this product; it moisturize him very well, and it helps with scratches too. Picked up my son from a baby sitter, and he had a huge scratch on his face, I used the cream on it and it was gone in about a week. I loved this product so much I ended up buying the advanced therapy for myself. Best decision. I recommend this product a thousand percent. The jar usually lasts me about 3/4 months, but it can last longer. I use it on my sons skin as well. Top-notch product.

I bought this because my LO was suffering from terrible diaper rashes that would come and go and not even Boudreauxs butt paste was healing it. Once I stopped using any other product, excluding a soap my grandma used for her bed sores (sorry, TMI), to clean her rash I learned to let her dry COMPLETELY then apply this baby aquaphor and it went away within 24 hours!!! I kid you not! DISCLAIMER: her rashes we‚Äôre not fungal or infected so please do not read this as medical advice! I only used this on bright red skin that hadn‚Äôt broken or scanned or produced sores.

Also, there is no smell, it doesn‚Äôt stain your finger nails, and you only need a little bit as it spreads like petroleum jelly.
Best buy that I‚Äôve made in the ‚Äúmedicinal‚Äù section for my daughter yet!

Pros:
Works really well. My daughter will get a bad rash and this helps heal it. You can tell a huge difference by the next diaper change.
No scent.
It doesn‚Äôt irritate when I apply.

Cons:
I prefer tubes rather than tubs, for the sake of not getting it under my nails.

There are two types- an ointment and a cream. Both work great.
We‚Äôve tried Desitin, and two types of Butt Cream, but so far this works best. I bought an extra container to keep at the daycare.

review name: A lot of uses in a bottle.
review text: I first bought this for my grandkid‚Äôs diaper rash. It works to prevent rashes then we also apply this in their knees and elbows when they were crawling. And I started using it for myself too, makes my feet soft by rubbing some then wear socks in the evening. Also good for chapped lips in winter. In fact, I use this everyday in my lips, makes it softer and smoother. I will never be without. Thank you.

This is the best product I've found that works wonders for diaper rash. My daughter has very sensitive skin and is always breaking out. We have tried many different brands of diaper rash that never worked. As soon as we started using this the rash is gone within a day. I like the different sizes it comes in, makes it convenient for traveling but love buying the 14oz tub. Definitely would recommend giving it a try!

I used it for a while at home, but then did some travel with a travel size, and the travel product worked much better. No harm in this tub, but I ended up throwing it away after suspiciously my travel size Aquaphor was much more effective and a slightly different color - this was more yellow than store bought travel tubes were clearer color. I think my online purchase from Amazon was counterfeit. Not sure if it was counterfeit, but these days what can you believe? Your baby's bottom might not know the difference between AQ and Petroleum Jelly, but as an adult using it, I do not believe this was Aquaphor.

review name: Best baby skin care product out there!
review text: Hands down one of the best baby products out there. I have used this on all four of my kids for all sorts of reasons. It's phenomenal! It takes away extreme diaper rash quickly, helps with dry sky and skin irritations. I've used this to get rid of cradle cap and cracked skin. My husband and I use this in winter on our dry skin as well. I've found other diaper creams really hurt my kids when I'd put it on them. This one never makes them cry. I recommend it to every new parent and add it to baby shower gifts all the time. We make sure to always have this in stock. My sisters are unable to get this where they live so I make sure to always keep them in stock too.

Please be aware of the quality of the content when buying it from this seller.I received my and it was not the real aquaphor. It felt weird/different between my fingers ( I've been using it for more than 8 years so i know how it is supposed to look and feel) it had a smell and was yellowish in color. I went to a pharmacy and brought another one to compare and boy!! Was i right. Please check before using especially on little ones.

We have been using Aquaphor for years. Its great for so many things. We originally started using it to lightly cover our skin when we got tattoos. At the time we had bought a large jar and started to use it for other things. It works wonders on chapped lips, skin rashes, eczema and burns. You don't have to glob it on just a thin layer. We even bought small containers to have in my purse or my daughter's backpack. The large jar will last forever.

review name: Good cream for babie‚Äôs eczema and dryness Of the skin
review text: We always use Aveeno eczema therapy for our childrens. But it didn‚Äôt work really well for our 2nd baby so we tried Aquaphor and it actually works. sometimes you have to apply it for 3-4 days everyday in the morning and night to get the best results. Good cream for babie‚Äôs eczema and dryness Of the skin.

(It didn't help that our previous tub of aquaphor had actually come with a trial sized aquaphor lotion, not the shampoo). Anyway, be careful. Our baby was in so much pain from this mistake. :( Hopefully she'll heal soon with the actual aquaphor, and hopefully (if I'm not the only person this happens to) they will switch up their color scheme to make their trial size shampoo look different from their lotion!

review name: Every home should have a jar in my opinion
review text: Our pediatrician kept praising Aquaphor over and over and recommended that we try it for every little thing but we never listened. Well, I hate to say it but he was right and we were foolish to not pick up a jar sooner than when our daughter was around 10 months. So many severe rashes and skin acne issues could have likely been avoided. Everyone in our household has found a use for Aquaphor (mommy-nipple pain), daddy (dry skin especially on legs), and baby (baby acne, rashes and severe dry skin on shins). We use it every day. It has been a life saver especially for the baby as the weather changes here in the South and all the humidity is leaving the atmosphere her skin has shriveled up and become so dry. If not for Aquaphor, I am sure that my daughter would need to make a trip to a dermatologist costing us tons of money that we need to be saving.

This is the miracle ointment that heals everything for my son. Even after really bad diaper rash, or when his skin gets irritated, this is the only thing that helps him heal. We use if for other things for him as well, like keeping his hair up in a spike at times. It's a must for diapering kids. We buy tubs of Aquaphor and go through it like water.
It really helped my baby diaper rash.

This product is wonderful for healing skin problems including skin irritation in the elderly or bedridden. Several reviewers have asserted that this is the same as Vaseline, not true. Vaseline is 100% petroleum jelly which occludes skin cells. Aquaphor is only 41% petroleum jelly so it allows air to get to the skin which is crucial to wound healing. It also contains other ingredients that promote healing and protect the skin. This is why dermatologist recommend it. The jar is huge so if you just want to try it order the small tube.
Disclaimer, I do not own stock in the company nor am I an employee of the company however I am a medical professional.

review name: The best ointment for a serious diaper rash!
review text: I never make reviews as soon as I get a product but holy wow!! I received this last night around 7pm and immediantly changed my son and slathered this thick goo all over his sore bum. He has never had a diaper rash that was this bad. I even called my Drs office and asked if I should go in since he was bleeding. They calmly told me unless it gets even worse in the next few days as long as we removed the irritant it should go away on it's own. After reading a LOT of reviews I settled on trying this ointment because people swear by it. I understand why they do. I put it on him and changed his diaper once again before bed time and put on new cream and a new diaper. By the morning his rash looked AMAZING! It was no longer bright red but a dull pink and the welts were completely gone. I will be reapplying this every diaper change for the next few days and I'm sure it'll be gone.

review name: Treat severe baby eczema combining pool therapy and Aquaphor
review text: Our baby has very dry skin. At around 1-month old, his pediatrician recommended Aquaphor. On the first try, his skin pretty much cleared up in a few hours. We were quite amazed with the quick result. However, when our baby was around 5 1/2 months old, his skin condition turned very severe, thick patches were developing on his face, neck and wrists. The doctor confirmed that he had eczema. No amount of Aquaphor seemed to help. We then tried Aveeno Eczema lotion, Burt's Bee, Honest beeswax ointment with no improvement at all. I researched a lot and came across some articles on using bleach bath for baby eczema. I didn't want to use the bleach, so instead we took him to a swim lesson - our baby not only loved the swim class, as soon as he got out of the pool, I noticed a dramatic difference in his skin. The chlorine killed most of the bacteria on the skin. The next day, his eczema was almost gone (after 2 months of having red, thick, stubborn patches)! Aquaphor then started to work great again to provide the moisture his skin needs, especially after the swim class.

I've also used it on minor scratches/scrapes she has managed to give herself and it helps to protect/clear up. I would recommend this product to any parent/care giver. The jar itself will last us a few months too, so don't be deterred by the price. It is well worth the money - not only by it's speedy healing "powers" but also in peace of mind.

review name: A must have in my family
review text:
When it comes to baby items I am rather picky on what I use. The doctor's are always finding this problem or that and of course severe diaper rash seemed to be a problem for my kids. One doctor recommended this before she ended up retiring and I was pushed towards other things by the next doctors. However, I always end up back to this. Although it says it clears up diaper rash within a certain amount of time, my kids have extremely sensitive skin so it sometimes takes longer. The main thing to remember is that the area that you are putting it on needs to be completely clean and dry or it will capture moisture under it and it may not work to its full potential. This helps with severely dry skin also. The best part is that it comes off my hands very well after using it on the kids. When my boys were little and I had to change them just about every hour, I would literally not leave home without this.

One other thing that I want to mention is that if you need to travel, this size of container is way too big (in my opinion). The ointment is very easy to remove from the container with a popsicle or craft stick of some kind and put it into a smaller container. Regular aquaphor is very thick and not as easy to use so if you are looking for something for your baby then you would most likely want BABY aquaphor instead of the regular aquaphor.

review name: Super helpful in our diaper regimen
review text:
My baby had a horrible diaper rash coming off antibiotics from the hospital that caused mad diarrhea. They gave us a prescribed mix of aquaphor and desitin. It didn't work. My baby's skin broke down in his groin and it was raw skin exposed.
I used this aquaphor and alternated with Pinxav (also on Amazon) and it cleared right up. I used he Pinxav when he needed a little more healing power, and the aquaphor OINTMENT (not the cream with zinc in it, but the petroleum based one show here) when we needed more barrier (maybe his skin was less red but we still wanted to protect it from his messes). Using those two appropriately really helped to clear it up. Also the aquaphor was helpful in cleaning up his broken skin. It delicately sloughed it off as it healed. I typically try to go the all natural route and am not a fan of petroleum and mineral oil, but I'll use what works!!!

review name: Great For Eczema and to Heal Diaper Rash
review text:
I initially bought the Baby Aquaphor because it was recommended by my doctor for his eczema. I was using this on his face and it can be greasy. It stains his sheets when I put it on his face. It works, it's just messy and people should be aware. I prefer using it if he's not going to be napping.

The tub says that it "relieves diaper rash within 6 hours." My son's diaper rash was never bad, but he's gotten a little red. I put this on him and by the time I change his diaper again, the redness is gone!

I've also used this on his cuts from baby scratching. It accelerates his healing. This is a must for the changing table and it will have uses for a long time. I've had my tub for a few months and I'm almost a quarter through it. Keep in mind that it does have an expiration date like all products of its kind. The date on mine is 12/2017, which indicates that the seller is providing these responsibly.

review name: Works great but icky and greasy.
review text: I have a love/dislike relationship with aquaphor. It's got a lot going for it. On the one hand, it is great at keeping cheeks from getting chapped by the wind, protecting irritated skin, and keeping moisture in. However, it is greasy looking and feeling, which can be pretty unpleasant. It can leave stains. It isn't fun to use. It isn't cheap. And it doesn't clear up diaper rash the way it claims. I certainly think it has it's place, and it does great for taking sensitive skinned little ones out in the wind and things like that, but I don't find that it does everything I would like, or with a pleasant consistency.

This stuff is AMAZING! My 4 month old had horrible exzema. we tired at least 6 different exzema lotions, bleach bathes, no bathing, nightly bathing, various ointments (bagbalm,lanolin, vasaline), special oils that go in the tub, special shampoos and soaps. but to no avail. every product causes a severe rash or was completely ineffectual. Next we tried unrefined coconut oil. This did not work on her skin problems but I will give it some creadit as it got rid of her weeping craddle cap in 2 nights. I was about ready to give up. The pediatrician had no advice other than "She will grow out of it." but that was little solace when my poor baby was crying and trying to itch her enflamed and dry skin. I didnt just feelbad for her. It kept her up at nights. and if baby isnt sleeping no one is. lol. Then I posted something on facebook and no less than 10 mom chimed in and said aquaphor! So I looked it up. Now if you read the ingrediants its basically lanolin mixed with vasaline. it also has alcohol which AIDS in drying and mineral oil which every mom on ever baby forum says to avoid like the plegue if your baby has sensative skin. (and as a first time mom baby oil is an obvious first try with dry skin. baby oil IS mineral oil. It made my poor baby's face look like someone took a blowtorch to it.) so I was sceptical but desperate and ordered a jar. GOD am I glad I did. None of its components worked alone on my kiddo, so why this stuff works is a mystery. but after two applications my babies skin was soft and all the redness was gone. much like vasaline this stuff will leave babys skin oily, but unlike vasaline it will soak in after about 20 mins. so I give Maddie(baby) a bath and then immediatly after the bath(dont even dry her) while her skin is moist I rub it all over and throw a diaper on. then I just let her hang out in a diaper while the stuff works its magic. this stuff also protects her face from getting chapped in the cold and in a matter of hours will heal any redness she may get from drool sitting on her skin. (teethers drool right through bibs its terrible). I've been using this stuff for a month now. I stopped for a few days and her skin started to revert back to its dry red blotchy state, so I know it was this stuff that worked and not just timing. (pedi said she must have grown out of it. in two nights? yeah right.) I would recomend this stuff to other mothers all day. and adults. its helped my husbands dry cracked feet too! Thank you, Thank you, Thank you, Aquaphor. Its so nice to sleep at night again. lol.

I brought this for my 1 year old daughter who's had eczema since she was 5 months old. I've tried everything from aveeno to steroids prescribed by her doctor and nothing has worked as good as this. I just received it a day ago and her skin is as smooth as it was before her eczema first appeared. All her rough patches are gone and her scratching has been brought to a minimum. I definitely would recommend this to anyone who has a child suffering from severe eczema and has ran out of options.

Maybe it is just me ... I purchased this product to use on myself, not for a baby. It is exactly the same product as the regular, but cheaper with the baby ointment label. I wanted to try it because I'd heard and read all the hype about Aquaphor. After getting this big jar of it, I am puzzled as to why it is so popular. It is just white petroeum jelly. Vasaline is a LOT cheaper and works just as well. Yes, I know that there are "other" ingredients in this, but there is not enough of them to make a bit of difference. If you are not familiar with Aquaphor, save your money. Also, this stuff is super greasy! If you do not mind being greasy, Bag Balm works a lot better. You cannot put this on your hands and then go do anything. It does not soak in well. I have used it right before bed, but even then, I am careful because I don't want this grease all over my sheets. Seriously, I just don't get why it is so popular.

One of this can last almost half year when used daily on face, arm, and legs on a 18 month old, so if you only use it occasionally, it‚Äôs maybe too big of a package for you.

review name: Great for many uses for babies and kids!
review text: Just to add to the many glowing reviews for this product - I have 3 kids, currently aged 1-6 years. I have been using Aquaphor regularly for years to put below my kids noses and around their mouths when they have a cold and runny nose and their skin gets all chapped. My son also gets bumpy scaly skin around his mouth and chin, so we put on a thin layer in the morning and at night and it keeps the inflammation and bumps down. Then when our third was born I discovered Aquaphor baby - it comes in a tub which is much easier to use then squeezing out from a tube (especially when it is cold and the product gets very hard to squeeze out), and you get much more for the price. I have been using this for my kids faces, eczema behind the knee, and for diaper rash, and it works great for everything. Plus, a little goes a long way - even with 3 kids a tub has lasted an entire year!

I bought this at the grocery store, but really wanted to write a review about it. My two youngest kids have had terrible cradle cap and I‚Äôve tried so many things. (Mineral oil and dandruff shampoo were recommended by pediatrician and didn‚Äôt help) I saw someone post about leaving aquaphor on their baby‚Äôs head overnight and decided to give it a try. It got a majority of it off the first time along with gently running a comb through, the picture is before I‚Äôve given her a bath to get the remaining off. I‚Äôd definitely recommend this for parents struggling to get rid of cradle cap.

At the recommendation of our paediatric dermatologist, we use this for our son's hemangioma (strawberry birth mark) which started to ulcerate and is in the diaper area. We put a glob over the ulceration and then put a non-stick bandage overtop. This works much better than vaseline for this purpose as this is thicker and stickier and therefore stays in place better and doesn't absorb as quickly into the skin providing better and longer lasting protection for the wound - keeping moisture in and everything else out - as well as keeping the diaper from rubbing on the sore. It not only helps the wound heal faster but, helps prevent pain, as well. Because we were already using this in the diaper area, I started putting a thin layer on the diaper area when there was redness and irritation and this has cleared that all up. I now put thin layer at every diaper change to create a barrier and prevent any future irritation from starting in the first place and this has worked wonders in that respect. Highly recommend!

This stuff is great. While this one states it's for baby; it works just like the regular version. The lanolin in this product is very effective and will usually heal chapped lips, feet, hands etc in about a day.

One use that I think may get overlooked is when you have a cold; rubbing this on your nose before bed will remove the soreness and chaffing almost every time. Can also use for breast feeding in a pinch; but should probably just use regular lanolin for that.

We use the Aquaphor more than the other brand as it's not pasty and doesn't have as strong of a smell; they both are very effective however but I give the nod to this product because of the texture and smell.

review name: Best cream out there for eczema
review text: aquaphor was suggested to us by the hospital where our babies were born. In fact we were handed out a big tub complimentary! It started out with being more for diaper rashes but slowly we realized that it was more so for the entire body. The hospital nurses in nicu used to massage the babies with this super cream daily. Soon we figured out that our girls have eczema and this was the goto cream in the first few months. As the tub got over I started experimenting with other eczema creams but it only seemed to flare up for my babies. Apart from this one, eucerin baby has one lotion with oatmeal for eczema relief and that was the only that also seemed to work but it was way too expensive and getting over too soon! I switched back to aquaphor and never looked back ever since and nor did the eczema. My babies skin is so smooth and eczema free that even the pediatrician complimented me on my babies beautiful skin!!! So all in all, eczema or no, I plan to use this for my kids as long as I possibly can. The downside is however the oily feel for a while, but it definitely gets absorbed in the skin in abt 15 mins or so and then all you have is soft moisturized skin!!!

Due to using a bad lip product,I had really dry, chapped lips for about 6 weeks that were painful and felt like they were bleeding. I tried a number of lip balms, and none of them worked. I finally came across Aquaphor, and decided to give it a try. Within a couple days, my sore, painful lips were on the mend. I've been using it for a couple weeks now, and my lips are good as new. I continue to use it a few times a day to help prevent chapped lips from happening again. Adore it!

This product was great for baby rashes. As soon as I saw the start of a rash, I slathered this stuff on and the rash would disappear after one or two more diaper changes.

The REAL reason I'm giving this 5 stars though is that it's the only product to help my husband with rashes. He works long hours, walking around, and some days he just gets rashes where sweat has been sitting and rubbing with his uniform. But he comes home, showers, and uses this stuff where ever it's needed and by the morning he's completely back to normal. It's like magic and we look for deals on this all of the time.

Great stuff- just wish it were cheaper. My twins get diaper rash without ointment so I use this as a skin guard and apply at every diaper change. Yes, I go through a ton of it and it is costly, but it keeps diaper rash away!

And the icing on the cake... I use the empty containers as toys for my kids. The sticker easily peels off and then I wash it, put the lid on and voila, a tiny drum or stacking toy, etc. They can also be used for crafts, Knick knack storage, etc.

review name: Really Great, but HATE That This is Petroleum Based!
review text:
UGH! Why is it that the best diaper cream we could find had to be petroleum based?

We did our due diligence and tried other, similar products. We tried pretty much every diaper cream there is, and many that are similar to Aquaphor like Burt's Bees Baby Bee Petroleum Free Multipurpose Ointment. Nothing worked as well as Aquaphor.

We mostly used cloth diapers, but when we used disposables on occasion our baby broke out in horrible rashes. Aquaphor was the only thing that worked to prevent a rash. It did NOTHING to treat them whatsoever. In those times, we mostly used coconut oil or calendula lotion.

I was told to just try straight Vaseline since its cheaper than Aquaphor and pretty much the same thing. We did that, and it didn't work as well. Aquaphor is unfortunately the best we tried.

review name: Great for Infant use & Adult use!
review text:
This is one of my all time favorite ointments on the market. I've tried the brands: A+D and Destin. They personally just don't compare!! This stuff lasts a long time! A little goes a long way!

I use this for diaper rash on my son, even when he was a newborn and scratched his face, I would put a very light layer on the wound and it would heal quick.

My husband works out in the weather and can ocassionally have his inner thighs rashed out due to working out in the heat. He was curious and tried this, and it brought him relief and cleared up fast. I've went to sleep but used it as chapstick, next morning my lips were soft and after wiping them off, they were no longer chapped.

Hands down the BEST thing to have on hand for a new or an older baby. It works as great ointment/spot treatment for dry skin but is the BEST defense and treatment for every day diaper rash (bad diaper rash or yeast rash you'll need to call in the big guns). Every diaper change I slap a little of this on and between 2 kids now I think I've only ever had one time where my son's diaper rash looked particularly ouchy. If you don't have at least a tube of this in your diaper changing arsenal, please rethink it and try it. Your baby's bottom (and that annoying crease in those chubby baby legs!!) will thank you.

review name: Best best best for all skin healing needs!
review text: Do not bother with any of those "butt paste" or any other diaper cream product! Seriously, this is amazing. Takes care of ALL skin care needs and can also be used by adults as well. CLears my baby's skin in no time - everything from diaper rash, heat rash, scrapes and nicks, even cradle cap - anything and everything! I use it on myself too; everything from burns, scrapes, to chapped lips. I mean this ointment is the best, period. Yes, it does feel greasy since it's not a lotion but works better than anything else.

Diaper rash, chapped lips, cuts and scrapes, seriously everything! Those first baby poops that are black and sticky, some aquaphor prevents the sticking! For cracked nipples from nursing, aquaphor is SO MUCH better than that expensive lanolin cream. We have been using aquaphor since my 4-1/2 year old was a baby, we buy the big tubs for the house and tubes for the cars and diaper bag.
The ointment is thick and provides a moisture barrier on the skin to help prevent and heal diaper rash like nothing else. I just can't say anoigh good about this product.

review name: Best cream for diaper rash treatment and moisturuzing
review text: I am fan aquaphor. Best baby cream, I use it on babies butt and face and sometimes on whole body. With this bad winter it is the best cream to keep baby moisturized. Butt rash goes away in 1-2 use as well.

review name: The is a baby MUST HAVE
review text:
The best baby cream ever! We used this with our first hold and I loved it so much we have stated using it for our second child.

It clears up diaper rash, is perfect to keep their skin dry and pretty much fixes all skin irritations out little ones have had and is even good for your chapped lips.

It's a must have and the tub really is the best bang for your buck.

My baby has a stubborn diaper rash. I tried several products, but none were working. I had a sample of this and gave it a try. It started working in 6 hours, just as promised, so I committed to buying this big jar. Then our pediatrician recommended using this on top of Desitin Max Strength. This, in combination with lots of air drying, is finally healing it up.

I did have a high expectation after reading all the five-star-review only to find nothing magic about this ointment. Thick and not easy to apply, leaving residue on the clothes. It is no better than A&D or petrolatum(both are way cheaper), and it did nothing k on my kids irritated chapped skin on her back.

I am so glad I decided to try these. We were using burts bee for his diaper rash but be he was still very red (up to his belly button) I keep thinking it seemed like it was from his diaper rubbing against his skin. So I brought this because it said it was good for chafeing. It worked right away, after one time we noticed a difference and but the third time it was gone. As long as we use it with every change he does not get any chafeing from the diaper. The only bad part is that it is very greasy but it is still worth it.

review name: Best and a must have for baby mama
review text: It's the best baby product I bought for my child since her birth. This product was recommended by my pediatrician as part of her ezcma regiment. We used it daily all over her. I am on my 5th tub now. Thank god they make this product. Thousands of thanks to the maker. Sometime even I use it for my winter cracked hands from over washing. A must have for any new mother with first born. I know my child and I will continue to use it for many years.

We found out this very helpful for our baby's dry skin.
At first we tried other products but still end-up with baby rash, after doc recommendation and trying we liked it much that we are not just using it for diaper area but legs/hands etc.

review text:
I love this stuff so much, I use it every day
Its has helped me with my exema problem
Also I use to have little bumps on the back of my arms and I dont have that problem anymore. I'm so thankful that I have this amazing product
This is the best thing for diaper rash. I‚Äôve tried just about every brand to clear up my sons rash and nothing worked until I put this on it. It cleared up in about two days.
Anyone with a baby MUST have this ointment. From diaper rashes to dry skin, this ointment does it all. It‚Äôs the best ointment for babies ever.

review text: After trying numerous creams with my first, this was the only rash cream that didn‚Äôt give him chemical burns. It healed his rash within hours, and has even worked on other mild skin rashes caused by his juvenile Psoriatic Arthritis. I will never use another rash cream again. Great value as compared to store prices.

review text: I heard great things about aquaphor for babies and I personally use aquaphor for adults for my dry skin and I love it. However, with my little one, aquaphor exacerbated his eczema and caused severe flare up which took awhile to clear up. So it wasn't for my baby. I would say, try sample or small size first before purchasing a big jar!

The best for diaper rash!!! Simply amazing how fast it heals and how wonderfully it prevents diaper rash! They gave this to us at the hospital after having my first little one. ive recommended it to all my friends. All are now using this product for their little ones! Much better than other diaper creams. Also this works great for anyone who has to constantly wash their hands. I am a barista and the sanitizer we have to use really damages and dries out my hands. This is the best thing I have found for that as well!

review name: The best for preventing diaper rash
review text: Baby went through one extreme bout of diaper rash and we used this (along with Rx cream) to help heal their sensitive skin within 5 days. We've been using daily ever since (over a year now) without any recurrence. Prior to this we were using the much-touted Boudreaux's Butt Paste at every change, but that did nothing to help prevent or heal the severe diaper rash. We are able to use much less of the Aquaphor compared to other creams/ointments, so the container lasts a very long time.

review name: This product is amazing. Used it on our now 3 year old ...
review text: This product is amazing. Used it on our now 3 year old when he was going through the teething stage and had very bad diapers that messed up his bottom quite bad. Used every diaper rash cream we could find, even had a pharmacy mix us up a special kind. Nothing worked like this did. Would put on after every diaper change (which was often during that time) and it helped but when it stayed on longer through the night while he slept the rash looked so much better in the morning. I recommend this product to all moms! Just bought another tub of it for upcoming baby while it was on sale, it can be kind of pricy but well worth it!
I got this and I could see it's impact just in a day. Good thing is that it is not sticky.
I have a sensitive nose and barely notice a scent. This works really well to help moisturize my baby's skin as well as mine. I'm always buying more.
using for my daughter for a while now.. it's not mush scented...but the cream is good for moisture and sensitive skin...skin also goes smooth..moisture lasts a long..she loves it...

I used to be sceptical towards Aquaphor thinking it was just overpriced petroleum jelly. But this thing is a miracle!!! It helps with literally ANY skin condition! It‚Äôs also perfect for sensitive skin. Love it!

I'm so pleased with the size of this for the price! My man uses it for inner thigh chafing, from working hot, 12 hour shifts. It really helps heal & soothe! My daughter uses her own little container for lips, elbows and hands. I use it for lips and my legs(after shaving to prevent razor bumps).

review name: Made my sons diaper rash worse!
review text: I liberatly applied this ointment to my sons bum after a bath and made sure his skin was dry before application. After about an hour I noticed his rash became intensively worse, even the areas of skin near it I applied the ointment to just for the heck of it. I'm not sure if he's just allergic or what but I will never be using this again and have no desire to try it for any other purposes it claims to be good for. Now I have been using the Aquaphor baby rash "cream" and that works wonderfully. I purchased the ointment in hopes of getting more product for the value but that simply was not the case. I checked the active ingriedients in both and noticed the cream was 41% petrolatum (petroleum jelly) and cream 15% zinc oxide, not sure if that has anything to do with it. Will definitely be sticking to the cream version, works wonders!

review name: Wasted $100's then finally found this..but keep 1 thing in mind!
review text:
I have been using and carrying around this product with me for years. It's safe, gentle, and dermatologist recommended. I've used it on my infant daughter's diaper rash when anything containing Zinc Oxide made her bottom bleed (she's allergic to that), and it cleared up overnight. She's 2 now, and we both still use it. I apply a small amount to my dry, bleeding and cracked cuticles at night, and they're smooth in the morning. It's also a great remedy for dry, cracked lips. I always keep a tube on me. It's expensive, but the 1.75 ounce tube lasts a very long time, and goes a really long way. I stick to what I like, and this product absolutely never disappoints!
There is one mistake I made recently I thought I'd share. I was at a Walgreens looking to purchase more, and chose the store brand over the Eucerin Brand. Big mistake!!

The store brand product immediately liquefied in a sort of filmy, slimy liquified version of something that's meant to soothe and coat your lips with moisture... Read more

It did nothing for my baby's diaper rash. It's honestly glorified vaseline/petroleum jelly. Get yourself a tub of vaseline and save yourself $10. Their 3 in 1 diaper rash is very good for diaper rash, so I recommend you get that instead of this waste of money.

review name: The Last and Only Diaper Rash Creme You'll Ever Buy!
review text:
I LOVE this product! When my two week old got a diaper rash that broke open causing bleeding sores and cracks, (rookie-mom fail!!) the pediatrician recommended this product. Every other zinc based product (Desitin, A+D, Buttpaste) seemed to DRY his skin, making the cracks deeper and nastier. Once we finally got the Doc's recommendation and got the Aquaphor, the rash was bad enough that we battled that particular outbreak for almost a month (combine frequent, slimy newborn poops with lots of wiping and you get a NASTY rash) but Aquaphor eventually won the battle. We saw results after the first application.
Fast forward 5 months and my now 6 month old and 18 month old godson are stricken with a gastroenteritis that results in terrible bouts of diarrhea. Horrendous diaper rash busted out on both tushies. Both babies came home from their sitters with redness spreading across their whole bottom and down their THIGHS! We SLATHERED Aquaphor on the areas and the 18month old was resolved overnight. The infant took an extra day to heal completely.
I use this for everything - I'm like the Dad in My Big Fat Greek Wedding with his Windex! Cradle cap (yes, your LO will look like a greasball, but it will be gone quickly) cuts, scrapes, burns, cracked cuticles or heels, eczema, sore breastfeeding nipples (wipe well before allowing wee one to nurse) and I've even used it on a scratch our dog got out in the yard. Just today I used it to clear up my infant's "paci-rash" - those lovely little red bumps on his chin from where his paci sits! This stuff works FAST and KEEPS the affected area healed. I throw it in every baby shower gift and recommend it to every Mom I run into in the diaper cream aisle. I find the Baby version and the "adult" version of this ointment work exactly the same way. I just buy whichever is cheaper at the store.

reviewer's name: La Vida Loca YouTube Keeping Up With The Reviews
review text:
Before my baby I used to enjoy writing reviews but with the 5 month old I can‚Äôt find time - plus I‚Äôd rather take a 4 minutes nap. However, whenever I stumble upon super awesome baby product or terribly bad one I feel moral duty to share with my fellow moms and dads who are struggling searching for the best for their baby.
So here is my humble contribution

Before using Aquaphor we used butt paste, for 4 months to be exact. I was going with regular strength for daily use and then whenever rash would come up I would switch to extra strength butt paste. I would also apply some witch hazel, and try to rinse my baby bottom in the sink - like every diaper change - I know that‚Äôs just ridiculous. But the rash would go away and then I would go back using regular strength butt paste, after few days repeat the cycle cause rash would come back. Even if using only extra strength kind rash would still go on and off and warm water treatment was the only solution. So I started to think OK I guess diaper rash is a must, it just comes with the baby? And then....Aquaphor !! No rash whatsoever. 3 weeks straight no rash. Then just to test it out I switched to butt paste...what was I thinking? After 4 days my little one got a rash. I applied Aquaphor that night, the very next morning rash was almost gone. I mean, it‚Äôs just no brainer for me. I also love that this ointment is clear, it doesn‚Äôt leave white marks everywhere like the butt paste. I mean, all our changing pads got stained when using extra strength- so thick it cannot be washed. Also, Amazon the BEST price for Aquaphor. If you buy it with subscribe and save the price is even better. TOUCHDOWN!!! You can stop searching, use next five minutes to get a nap instead. You‚Äôre welcome :)

I want to start by saying that I truly love Aquaphor. It is an awesome product and works great for my baby's bum as well as his drool rashes. The issue I'm having is that the "Aquaphor" I've been recieving from Amazon is actually petroleum jelly! It's like I'm getting the real Aquaphor tub and a cheap trick inside! Not sure who is supplying this but I certainly don't wish to pay $13 for petroleum jelly. I can tell it is not working as effectively on my son's skin as the real Aquaphor. So strange! I've recieved 3 tubs of what appears to be petroleum jelly. I actually used an entire tub to just test it. I can definitely tell it's not the real thing. I am sending back the 2 I just recieved. So weird! Amazon please fix this! Until I'm confident about getting the real stuff I'll buy it from my local drug store or grocery store but it's much more convenient as a parent to order it. Bummer!

My baby suffers from Cradle Cap which in turns makes almost his whole body break out. I've tried everything the Pediatrician suggested. (Coconut oil and almond oil) Brought Organic Coconut oil and let it soak in then, brushed It while I shampooed his hair. It was a waste of money and it made my baby bald. My OBGYN suggested to buy this cause it worked for her baby. Being skeptical I brought the small tubes on Amazon. Within two days the scabs and rashes started clearing up. Once I finished the small tubes the cradle cap started to come back a few weeks later. So now I'm back on here to buy the jar. This is a God Send. Plus this is the cheapest price by far for this. I went to target and it cost $5 more.

review name: Got rid of eczema that's been haunting me for a decade
review text:
Wow! This ointment worked a miracle for me!
I've been battling stubborn eczema on my index fingers and hand knuckles for at least 12 years! Yes, 12!! I tried all kinds of remedies, and finally settled for using lip balm to keep it at bay, always carrying a small can of it in my pocket and applying to my index fingers and knuckles after every time I washed my hands. If I failed to follow that procedure the skin on my fingers would quickly dry and crack; bleeding would follow within a couple of days; that was very painful and sort of debilitating.
My friend recommended that I should try Aquaphor: wash my hands, apply it on evenings before sleep and cover it with cotton gloves. Results came up in a matter of couple of weeks! My skin got softer, the yellow, callusey spots on my index fingers that were the dry skin patches got smaller and smaller and were soon replaced by pink, healthy looking skin.
I've been using Aquaphor for 3-4 months now and the improvements have become permanent, I am not carrying around the lip balm can any longer. I even stopped using Aquaphor for one month when I was on vacation and I had no problem with dry skin! This ointment is amazing! Highly recommended to everyone with hand aczema!

I gave 4 stars for everything because I‚Äôm delighted with this product - but not for moisturizing reasons, etc that it‚Äôs made for.....
I use this on a very thin (maybe 1‚Äù in diameter) bird feeder pole..... Yes - I SMEAR dear Aquaphor allllll around the pole - top to bottom to keep the raccoons from climbing up and eating alllll the seed. They are very agile! In the past I have tried Vaseline, wd40 and various oils (even generic, store brand Aquaphor copycats) - NONE of which works as good as the Original! This one seems to be thicker than any others and STICKS. Sure, sometimes after a couple days of 90 degree blaring sun some will slide down - but sometimes that doesn‚Äôt even happen. I do continually smear some fresh stuff on top maybe once a week - just In case - as I‚Äôm out of town a lot. But if you‚Äôre looking for a raccoon and squirrel deterrent- here you go!!!

We've tried many creams over the years with our two kids and found this to work the best at repairing and protecting their bums. They get the usual amount of rashes and nothing we've tried cures the redness than this. I'm sure everyone is different and some creams work better than others depend got the kid, but we've been reordering this for the past couple years because it's done exactly what we want. Spent $ of fancier bottles too and found better results with the aquaphor. Not sure how different the baby version is then regular aquaphor, but found both get the job done.

Aquaphor is a must to have in your house! I don‚Äôt care if you don‚Äôt have babies or toddlers, this stuff is amazing on all kinds of skin irritations. One example - I recently moved and am missing my manicurist desperately!! I haven‚Äôt found one that I like nor have I found one that doesn‚Äôt charge an arm and a leg!! Needless to say my feet are looking pretty bad and I got a couple of cracks in my heels. So, before going to bed one night, thought what the heck and I slathered my whole foot, with special attention to my heels, with Aquaphor. I then put on a pair of socks. Woke up the next morning with. The softest feet EVER!!! Cracks were also completely healed.

For another example, I‚Äôd like to use my granddaughters, ages 3 & 2. The 2 year old still wears diapers and the 3 year old is completely potty trained during the day and just about trained through the night. Unfortunately, they both inherited their Mom‚Äôs extremely sensitive skin. So sensitive, that if they have stooled in their diaper, their skin is fire engine red and excoriated within 15 mIn of the diaper remaining on their person. After this occurring one too many times, their parents decided to apply Aquaphor with EVERY diaper change. They have not had a single diaper rash since the oldest granddaughter was a few months old!!! Their parents should take stock out in Aquaphor as much as they use it and go thru it. They can‚Äôt do that‚Äôs where Amazon comes in handy!!! They definitely have the lowest price on the largest quantity and it is worth every single penny!!

We also use it on their pink, wind blown cheeks for fast healing and continuous protection. I‚Äôve used it on my cuticles and I apply it to my lips every night. It‚Äôs an absolutely amazing product with healing and protective properties that are the best bar none. You won‚Äôt be sorry after purchasing.

I went through at least three of the big name diaper creams before giving this a try on our daughter and this will tackle the worst rashes (as in it's actually slightly bleeding type rashes) like a champion. It gave her such instant relief you would forget she even had a rash, and the wound would heal up within 1-2 days. This stuff is amazing! My mother says she also used the same cream after her oncologist recommended it for her chemo treatments years ago. She never had any of those sunburn type effects cancer patients complain about.

It‚Äôs marketed as healing oIntment for baby diaper rash, but it‚Äôs the best nightime moisturizer I‚Äôve ever used. Read about it in an article re drugstore products that work as well or better than the high priced ‚Äùskin programs‚Äù sold by various cosmetic lines. A small amount goes a long way for face, neck, etc. in the morning my skin is smooth and soft for easy, effective application of cosmetics (or not!). I also apply to my feet and wear light socks at night. It results in beautifulLy moisturized feet, perfect for summer sandals wear. A 14 hour oz jar lasts me almost a year.too!

We found that Amazon has the best price currently. We used subscribe & save for an even better price.

Great for our babies‚Äô bums.

The tub is a better buy for us since we go through a tube at least one a month but the tub lasts for several months. I also felt like I had to squeeze the daylights out of the tubes near the end or waste a lot of ointment near the cap. Here there‚Äôs no issue of waste.

We still get a tube for the diaper bag but the big tub works best for us with a little jar of qtips for application.

review name: NOT for skin recovery/after care of any kind - it is NOT the same as regular
review text:
Do NOT use this for any recovery skin care/laser/dermatology/burn. I had a procedure done with four other girls and used this for five days. They had the regular Aquaphor. They had NO pain with their recovery and my skin was burning, red, and needed pain killers. On day five I received the regular Aquaphor and when I put it on the burned skin I immediately could tell a soothing difference.

The jar and company may say the ingredients are the same, but there must be more or less of something (or not mentioned), and I noted the website does not include burns for the "baby" product as it does for the regular. I am disposing of this jar and will not use again.

Purchased for my son who has sensative skin. Works amazing. Weather it's just a spot or used for diaper rash, it clears the area affected, without leaving a nasty feeling afterwards, not sticky. I don't personally think it has a scent. My older daughter use it on all their scraps and it heals them up great, no infections ever from using this product. I recommend to all parents. It's worth every penny . It's a great value, great product.

This is the best ointment ever. It‚Äôs very gentle and yet can tackle rough or very sore skin. It doesn‚Äôt rub in and disappear like lotion does on your skin because it has more of a Vaseline texture but it‚Äôs lighter than Vaseline. It‚Äôs great for the chapped or cracked skin on feet and yet gentle enough to use on a baby‚Äôs diaper rash.

As a mother of 6, I've tried my fair share of diaper creams. Let me tell you this diaper cream is gold! A year ago my son had a terrible diaper rash that lasted for weeks. No other diaper creams were working but as soon as I tried this diaper cream it cleared up within a few days. Now if he gets even the slightest diaper rash I put this on and it's gone in no time. I wish I had tried this diaper cream with my other children. This will be the only diaper cream I'll be using from now on.

You can pretty much bet you will end up with Aquaphor marks on your walls from greasy kids hands but I think it‚Äôs worth it.

review name: Works Wonders On Skin Ailments, Not Just For Babies
review text:
I've been using Aquaphor on my baby since the day she was born. I love how it protects her bum from diaper rash. What I love even more is the fact that any time she has a rash, this fixes it within a day or two of repeated use. I just apply it on the affected area and it goes away.

What I never knew though, was that it works well for healing wounds even for adults. When I visited my dermatologist a few months ago and she performed a biopsy on my skin, she told me to use Aquaphor for healing the wind. I never heard of that, as I always used Neosporin or Bacitracin. She said that Aquaphor does just as good without any potential allergies to the mentioned ointments. They even recommend it to all their patients. I was stunned!

Aquaphor truly is magic in a jar.

review name: So for new mommies who don't know what to do with your baby's skin please try Aquaphor and don't waste your money on other cream
review text:
My baby has extreme eczema, his skin would turn raw and pink and it would ooze sometimes. My doctor prescribed a cortizone ointment that would help with the eczema patches but I needed something to keep his skin moisturized to prevent an outbreak. I tried Vaseline, Aveeno, Cetaphil, oatmeal baths and nothing worked. Finally, I tried Aquaphor with really low expectations. It had the consistency of Vaseline so I thought I had just thrown 14 bucks down the drain. I applied it to my son's entire body and applied thick coats to his eczema patches before I put on his PJs. The next morning, his skin was soft, not entirely baby soft but it didn't have that coarse leathery feel either! His eczema patches had been reduced to a light light pink! I was totally in shock.
So for new mommies who don't know what to do with your baby's skin please try Aquaphor and don't waste your money on other creams.

I've read a lot of good reviews about Aquaphor and decided to try it for my daughter's diaper changes. I replaced Desitin with Aquaphor for nighttime diaper changes and within a couple days, my daughter broke out into a rash. I immediately went back to Desitin and it cleared up. It's good for daytime diaper changes but not enough coverage/protection for the night. Vaseline, however, works well in that case and is much less expensive so I will stick it that going forward. I happened to use a bit of Aquaphor on my super dry hands at night and by morning they were re-hydrated so I will keep it around in my medicine cabinet as a moisturizer.

This stuff is great. I have been using it nearly every diaper change to prevent any diaper rashes as the ped said it would provide a protective barrier between baby and dirty diapers.
